etymology.description: 宀(宀) (mián, 'roof') + 豕(豕) (shǐ, 'pig') = pig under a roof -> home, house
etymology.interpretation: The character 家(家) (jiā, 'home; family; house') uses the pictorial elements of a 'roof' and a 'pig' to evoke an ancient image of a house, where pigs were commonly kept under the same roof as a family, indicating the concept of a home.

examples.chinese: 我爱我的家(我愛我的家)。
回家路上遇见老朋友(回家路上遇見老朋友)，聊起往事(聊起往事)。
examples.pinyin: Huí jiā lùshàng yùjiàn lǎo péngyǒu, liáo qǐ wǎngshì.
examples.english: On the way home, I met an old friend, and we reminisced about the past.
